Summary: Head of Engineering for EMEA of the Merchant Banking Division (MBD) at Goldman Sachs. The Merchant Banking Division is a ~$140bn diverse Investing and Lending business, and the primary centre for Goldman Sachs’ middle-market financing and investing activity. This global, multi-asset class business invests in all levels of the capital structure based on a risk-adjusted return basis. The Merchant Banking Division has three main investing themes: Private Equity (eg. Corporate, Infrastructure and Growth), Credit (eg. Private Corporate, Specialty Lending and Distressed Secondary), & Real Estate (eg. Hard Assets and Distressed Mortgage Portfolios). Strats+Tech help the business with: Portfolio Management (eg. Tools, Systems and Analytics), Hedge Analysis (eg. Across all asset classes: Public Equity, FX, Commodity, Credit and Interest Rate), Investment Structuring (eg. Capital and Tax efficiency), Workflow Automation (eg. Migration from bespoke ad hoc Excels to scalable Web Applications), and Funding Optimisation (eg. ALM and Fund Allocation). The Merchant Banking Division is one of the four key revenue generating Divisions of Goldman Sachs. The other three revenue generating Divisions being: Investment Banking Division (IBD), Securities Division (SecDiv), and Consumer & Investment Management Division (CIMD). Previous experience includes the Market Marking of Credit products (including Loans, Bonds and CDS) and providing Investment Banking advice to Financial Sponsor clients. Holder of a DPhil (PhD) in Information Engineering from the University of Oxford, specialising in Medical Image Analysis and Signal Processing.

Summary: Following a successful, multi award winning, career spanning over a decade, working at a Senior Level for some of the largest UK insurers I felt that there was a gap in the market, giving specialist protection advice to clients while working alongside accountants, mortgage brokers and other professional connections as a specialist consultant, particularly in London and the South East.  In that time I helped to design and market new protection products and train advisers on the importance of protection. In 2014 it was time to use this specialist knowledge to help clients directly, and Heath Protection Solutions was born.   Accountants have a relationship with their clients like no other professional service, being the go to resource for tax, business advice, business forecasting, valuations and more.  The accountant is uniquely positioned to know about the key factors of their clients business, inc any directors loans,  and be the one person the business owner(s) would be willing to listen to regarding their need for mitigating their business risk. Mortgage brokers know the value of protecting the home for their clients, they have a responsibility to talk about protection, but due to mortage volumes and increased compliance often find it difficult to find the time needed to dedicate to protection.  Working in partnership with brokers offers the client the best of both worlds.  Protection advice can be complex, there have been huge changes in the products provided here in the last 10 years, particularly in the Critical Illness and Income Protection market and I felt that clients needed guidance to make sure the products they buy are the most suitable.  With changes occuring in the market place all the time, I add the commitment of regular reviews to ensure sure the solutions continue to offer the cover clients need. Outside of work I love to explore new places, home and abroad, and imagine myself as the intrepid explorer.

Summary: Highly experienced London Mortgage Broker and owner of Rose Capital Partners. Specifically focused on clients with larger and more complex incomes. Also seeking partnerships where we can help firms with such staff such as Private Equity, Venture Capitalists, Tech, FinTech, Entrepreneurs, Start-Ups, Company Directors, Self-Employed and many more. Being one of the top London Mortgage Broker firms, we are very adept at helping all types of clients, whether you are a First Time Buyer, home Mover, looking to Remortgage, or need help with a Buy To Let, myself and the team have vast experience in these areas and a very willing to help. At Rose Capital you’re a valuable, respected client, who we would like to help, not simply a property transaction, as others in the property world may see you. We seek to work with you in the long-term from first home, through to debt-free retirement. I am very interesting in working directly with firms who's staff/owners/Directors/Partners have more complex incomes and may need more assistance when coming to arrange finance. As a business owner myself I know all too well the hoops and roadblocks you face. However, we are experts in presenting cases correctly which will secure you preferential terms, as we have many exclusive arrangements with both High Street lenders and Private Banks. As stated above, we will then help you manage the debt down and assist you in your journey to being mortgage free and financially independent come retirement. I am also very passionate about helping improve both my team and my clients mental health. Getting debt free is naturally a huge help in that area. However, we are frequently seeing the downsides of people facing burn out or specific events which adversely affects their mental health. If you fall into this camp, please talk to me as while I am not qualified to help you in that area, I very much am in understanding the impacts on you and am often able to obtain better terms for you on lending if we have an open dialogue about past issues. If I can help remove some of the stigma that surrounds mental health in finance, that would make me immensely proud to have such a positive impact on our industry.

Summary: Niki Beattie has over 25 years of financial markets experience and is a specialist in capital markets infrastructure.  She also has 10 years of corporate governance experience in the industry. She began her career in working in technology at Security Pacific/Bank of America and went on to work at Merrill Lynch for 14 years where she became Managing Director and Head of Europe, Middle East and Africa Market Structure (EMEA). She is now Managing Director of Market Structure Partners (MSP), a firm she founded in 2008.   MSP undertakes market intelligence, strategy and implementation work, often related to regulatory and technology changes in global financial market structure, to trading platforms, clearing houses, technology firms and market participants.  In addition to her consulting work, she has extensive corporate governance experience in financial market infrastructure and financial technology companies.  She is Non Executive Chairman of XTX Markets and of Aquis Exchange and also currently a Non Executive Director of Iress, Kepler Cheuvreux UK Ltd and the FICC Markets Standards Board. She was previously a Non Executive Director of Borsa Istanbul and of MOEX, the Moscow Exchange. She has also been a member of the FCA's Financial Regulations Committee and sits on the Secondary Markets Advisory Committee of the European Securities Markets Authority (ESMA).   In previous roles, Niki has been instrumental in creating competition and change in the European trading environment; spearheading the development of the trade reporting system BOAT, the Trade Ideas system and acting as a key founder of Virt-x and Turquoise, as well as working closely with the UK and European regulators on the evolution of MiFID. With a history of experience across global markets, she has built a strong buy and sell side following for her knowledge and opinions on the subject of exchanges, clearing and electronic trading.   Niki has a first class honours degree in Information Systems and Management.

Summary: Previously CEO and owner of Straightpoint since 2002 until the acquisition by The Crosby Group in January 2019, and now President of the newly-formed FAD Equipment Store, I am an instinct driven entrepreneur with a focus on product development, marketing and distribution networks. Success is based on formulating long-term, one-page plans with specific goals, then breaking everything out into annual plans, and finally into 90-day planning that cascades down throughout my teams. I am a big exponent of the book ‘Rockefeller Habits’ and share author Verne Harnish’s belief that a company should never stop developing and that momentum plays a huge part in continuing success. This is reflected as an intrinsic part of my DNA, which is a major driver of my proactive professional acumen. My businesses encourage risk taking and yet, at the same time, uphold the instillment of individual responsibility over all endeavours to advance the company. A supportive environment means that my teams have always exceeded expectations and their achievement has fed through into our world-class, innovative products and services. My ongoing vision is of aggressive but sustainable growth as I look to manage the future of FAD Equipment Store, continuing our outstanding pace of product selection and growth. My industry experience includes oil and gas, shipping, construction, renewable energies, lifting and cranes, topside and tie downs, mining, entertainment, water bag testing, breakbulk, utilities, and military applications.

Summary: 38 years in banking and financial services. And my passion here has helped me stay relevant when this sector has undergone consistent transformations globally. The love for economics, started with my career at Bank Hapoalim where I was promoted quickly as the Branch Manager. Where I enjoyed serving and learning both - 'people' and 'finance'. After two decades of my dedication to this bank, I met Nissan Trif who seemed (and is always) one step ahead in his business and services. He was founding 'MoneyNetint' and his vision completely changed my perspective. Today, after 18 years of its inception, MoneyNetint makes me feel the same excitement as it did way back in 2002. What is MoneyNetint? A full package of payment solution - both pay-in and pay-out. A true one-stop-shop for businesses.  Going global, growing a team of exciting and dedicated talent and the uniqueness of growing MoneyNetint like a family, gives the employees and clients feel like family too. The excitement of staying ahead in business and being cared for as a family is the uniqueness of what MoneyNetint provides. It has been a pleasure being a part of the team that built MoneyNetInt, an Electronic Money Institution that provides leading payment solutions around the world for:  -E-Wallet Management  -SEPA & SWIFT Payments  -Designated IBAN  -Automated Clearing House Payment Services  -Credit Card Processing  -Prepaid Debit Cards  -Merchant Payment Solutions  -Cash Pay-Outs  MoneyNetInt enables clients to pay in local currency quickly and in the most effective manner while working with:  -Payment Service Providers  -E-Commerce Companies  -Gaming Companies  -Marketing Agencies  -FX Traders  -Affiliates It is exciting to be a part of this era in finance where digital technology is transforming the relationship between the banks and the businesses, using mobiles and digital banking. The way blockchain has revolutionized the way we do transactions. There is an embracing beauty when the money is not spent on the bank fees but on the valuable services. Being a people's person with a keen interest in finance for business, international payments, and international money transfers, I love networking and connecting to like-minded and passionate people with a similar interest. And discussing the endless possibilities and the new-age transformation of finance in the digital era.

Summary: Over the years of advising on the property market, we have experienced many periods of uncertainty, as we do now. Our overwhelming advice to our clients is that understanding their options will allow them to make the right financial decisions to benefit them.  Of course, buying in an uncertain market normally brings financial reward but the reality of what can be borrowed and what realistically can be bought (whether main residence or buy to let) is a complicated process which we unravel. Alternatively, for our clients not in a position to buy right now, tying to low fixed rates brings benefit and security. Finally, for our clients that wish to sell, we are able to help you borrow 90% of the property price interest free, before selling in order to buy your new home, especially important in an uncertain market. Whatever your property thoughts, AS Financials totally independent advice led service will help you focus and achieve your goals. We are here for a sophisticated discussion to highlight some areas that can benefit you, whether you need a mortgage or not. Our focus is advice and our clients’ needs, not your mortgage.

Summary: 5*-rated presenter, researcher and author on human-factor risks, improvement of Conduct and related controls, embedding modern risk-aware working practices in regulated financial firms. Consistently 5*-rated workshops on: Earlier warnings of “bad behaviour'; better control designs; human-factor risks (including cyber); reputational risk and regulatory capital; reporting on culture; reducing uncertainty; identifying overlooked sources of hazard - and business value. Verified skills: - Plain-speaking guide to regulatory agendas and impacts; control regimes premised on behavioural risk.  'Do's and dont's' for practitioners (and regulators). - Sparking new dialogue among business leaders to see risks in a new light, to support positive change in risk-taking culture, to map uncertainties and better frame decisions. - Teaching how to predict behaviour change (e.g. how much [more] risk/uncertainty will stakeholders tolerate before they cut loose?) - Practical guide to business value by 'culture audit': What drives culture; how best to report on this; which types and points of intervention work best to transform culture and build resilient value - Showing why people break your carefully built control systems: how to prevent the 'What Actually Happens effect” hitting you - Drawing staff happily into regular conversations about risk-aware working practices, exemplary conduct, behavioural lens on risk-taking - Restoring value, trust and capital with 'damaged' groups (e.g. when a control or intervention fails; market access, social capital, brand or premium are ebbing.) Consults, writes and facilitates by invitation for trusted colleagues in professions and industry, government agencies/NGOs and academia.  Welcomes opportunities to analyse and advocate for: - better-governed, transparent and resilient markets;  - risk controls and reports that are alert to behaviour and situational change; - anti-corruption; - clearer self-knowledge in organisations (fully to 'know what we know').

Summary: Richard was commissioned into the Royal Green Jackets in 1978 and served in Northern Ireland, the Far East and the Middle East on counter-insurgency, counter-terrorism and counter-human trafficking operations.   In 1989, he joined the FCO. He held a number of domestic and overseas appointments, serving in Iraq (1990 -91, 2004 – 05); Stockholm (91 – 93); Geneva (97 – 99); Kosovo (99 – 00). In late 2000, he was seconded to the Home Secretary to help coordinate the Government’s response to the fuel crisis. His post incident report led to the creation of the Civil Contingencies Secretariat within the Cabinet Office which now has the responsibility for coordinating all national emergency response planning. He ran the operational commands for Central Europe (01 – 03) and then Eastern Europe (03 – 04).  On return from an eighteen month posting in Baghdad in 2005, he was posted to the Cabinet Office to coordinate the intelligence requirements on a range of national security issues for No 10, the Foreign and Commonwealth Office and the Ministry of Defence.  In 2007, he was the first non-police officer since 1947 to be appointed as a Chief Constable when he took over command of the Civil Nuclear Constabulary (CNC). He served on the national police body responsible for delivering the UK’s national Counter Terrorism strategy – CONTEST.  And on the national police Interoperability Board.  He also served on the Department of Energy and Climate Change’s Nuclear Security Board designed to deliver a more integrated and coordinated national nuclear security strategy. During his time at the CNC, he provided advice to several overseas governments on a range of nuclear security issues, both from an operational and a regulatory perspective. In 2012, he set up Elvaston Global Ltd, a security and risk based advisory company and co-founded Advanced Laser Imaging. He is now the CEO of Facewatch, a tech based company that provides an online crime reporting platform for businesses.

Summary: During twenty years’ experience within the electrical wholesaling industry I have successfully managed three separate Electrical Wholesalers including branches at both Wilts Wholesale & Edmundson Electrical.  Beginning my managerial career as Branch Manager at Wilts Wholesale Portsmouth at the age of twenty-four, I managed the business for six years. During those six years the business saw a growth from a £1.4 million annual turnover to a £3.4 million turnover within the first two years whilst maintaining our gross profit margin and achieving record profits over the forthcoming four years.  Approached then by Edmundson Electrical to manage their JBM Portsmouth branch; JBM Portsmouth at the time of being appointed had an annual turnover of £700k; within the first fifteen months of being within the position, business achieved in excess of £3.2 million sales whist again maintaining the heathy gross profit margins that the branch was achieving on £700k sales. JBM Portsmouth become the most profitable branch from a portfolio of thirty-two branches within the South East region of Edmundson Electrical.  Following the success of JBM Portsmouth, I was then promoted to Branch manager of Edmundson Electrical Crawley which was the largest (with regards sales) branch in the South East region with an annual turnover of five million pounds. Over the next five years sales increased in excess of ten million pounds and Crawley branch became the largest and most profitable business in the South East region.  Since gaining the experience from managing different sizes business over the past fifteen years, there was now an opportunity to create a business which will trade through multiple branches, with the first being our Crawley branch, each operating at a lower more manageable annual turnover whilst implementing all the key features we believe have given the edge in the market place.  From my twenty years experience within this sector, Quantum Electrical Distribution was born.

Summary: Managing Director of Quorum Technologies, UK-based manufacturer of sample preparation equipment for SEM, TEM and CryoSEM. 20+ years experience in analytical instrumentation. After a while, I became aware that there were problems that I didn't know how to fix. Things to do with ROI, WACC and SWOT. So I moved to France to study for an MBA at INSEAD, which taught me the meaning behind the buzzwords and gave me the tools to move into general management, where I've been for over a decade. The systems are more varied now and my screwdriver may be labelled 'Five Forces' but I'm still loving the challenge of fixing problems.

Title: Director

Summary: I enjoy my life - too many interests, not enough time. I made my first investment when I was 10 and used investment profits to set up Ionic Information.  Investment decisions are so important to both the investor and the wider society.  Which company can raise money on the stock market is determined by investors or their nominees – do your own research and be wise! Running a company is a challenge.  There are always processes that can be done better, new marketing ideas, improvements to how users use and understand each product.  In the end, it is an enjoyable process; if I didn't find it interesting I wouldn't do it. I got interested in computers in 1973 and bought my first computer in 1979 – an MK14 which I constructed with a soldering iron.  It had 128 bytes of memory but this was expandable to 256 bytes. So very exciting, the possibilities were endless. And now we have the internet, mobile phones and something approximating AI.  All that in 70 years.  In another 70 years the change may be even more dramatic.  I just hope medical advances keep me going to enjoy the ride. I firmly agree with Richard Feynman’s quote: “there’s plenty of room at the bottom”.  I’m far more interested in nano and molecular than cosmos.  We will make extraordinary advances with DNA editing, molecular machines, brain enhancements, novel materials with bizarre properties and other things we can’t conceive of today.  Society is changing dramatically – it’s scary and unpredictable but we have no choice but to ride it out – so we might as well do our very best embrace it.  Then there’s the family and friends. Love you all!

Summary: I run three small businesses in and around financial services; Intelligent Partnership, in:review and MICAP.  Together, and in different ways, my businesses help financial and investment capital flow into thousands of UK businesses. This is my passion, because I believe effectively deploying capital not only helps businesses grow faster, but brings untold benefits to entrepreneurs and has a positive impact on society.  To recognise the positive impact of capital on businesses I launched the Growth Investor Awards in 2015, 100 Stories of Growth campaign in 2017, Mindful Investor and the Growth Finance Awards in 2019.  100 Stories is an evidence-based, story-led, evergreen initiative that investigates the vital capital, incentives and support available to fast-growing SMEs across all sectors in the UK. Through research findings, founder storytelling and thought leadership, we are creating a roadmap for high-potential business success. Together, with 100 entrepreneurs, we are kicking off a much needed ‘capital debate’ in the UK. Through the work and commitment of my fantastic colleagues in all three businesses, we are teaching investment gatekeepers about the risks, benefits and ways of investing in small businesses.  While also uncovering the ‘invisible’ growth journeys of high-growth businesses and signposting where entrepreneurs can get the funding and support they need to start-up, scale-up and stay up.

Summary: DRS Bond Management is an acknowledged leader in surety broking, formed with the single-minded objective of delivering a state of the art approach to bond management and surety advisory services. Precision defines DRS, providing certainty to clients through an exacting, reliable and responsive focus. DRS is the trusted surety advisor to leading names in the construction and engineering sectors, as well as other companies in multiple sectors. Bringing together deep expertise in corporate governance and surety broking, gained from some of the world’s leading public companies and broking organisations, the DRS team combines these complimentary skill sets to enable clients to utilise surety to create lasting competitive and financial advantage. Through rigorous management training and a dedication to professional development, DRS remains at the forefront of the growth and application of surety. Detailed discovery of requirements, thorough surety market examination and the issue of accurate documentation, DRS delivers. From first contact to final contract, DRS is dedicated to a commitment to clear communication that supports client understanding. Timing is everything; facility capacity is critical and DRS supports clients in managing their bond capacity parallel with contract completions, ensuring that the ability to bond forthcoming immediate contracts is never compromised. DRS offers first class access to ‘investment grade’ (minimum A- Standard & Poor’s rating or equivalent) surety capacity delivered by the world’s leading sureties. DRS arranges surety solutions for a vast range of bonding needs, including: Performance Bonds; Retention Bonds; Advance Payment Bonds; Highways Bonds; National House Building Council (“NHBC”) Bonds; Bid Bonds; Duty Deferment Bonds; Rural Payment Agency (“RPA”) Bonds; Waste Resources Action Programme (“WRAP”) Bonds; Transfrontier Shipment of Waste Bonds; Restoration Bonds; Letter of Credit (“LOC”) Replacement Guarantees.

Summary: Are you a business owner running a £1m-£60m+ company and considering retirement?  Have you contemplated selling up, but are unsure of your exit strategy?  Perhaps you’ve thought about finding an investor to help you get to the next level of turnover and you need help with the ins and outs of doing this.  As a business buyer and mergers & acquisitions specialist with eight years’ experience helping business owners ready to sell or seek investment opportunities, I can help.  I started my finance career in the late 1990s working as a consultant for various top ten London law firms. I then moved into consulting, and worked at boutique investment firm Mansford Holdings. It was during this time that I gained a deep understanding of the investment world. I discovered exciting investment strategies, and ultimately became interested in portfolio investments and acquisitions.  The M&A industry has a reputation for being notoriously unscrupulous, and I wanted to rebel against this. Consequently, Verdani Investments was born.  We are a team of unequivocally straight-talking investors who pride ourselves on our ethical approach to M&A. We align ourselves with our clients’ goals, and only buy or invest if we genuinely believe in the company’s objectives.  So how does it work?  First of all we’ll discuss your business performance and objectives and, if it aligns with us, we’ll ask for your last three years of accounts from which we make a valuation assessment.  Next, we propose a structure for purchasing or investing in your business.  The final step is the buying of or investment in the business.  We help our clients feel confident and positive about their impending exit strategy. We give them the tools to release cash from the company and, ultimately, figure out their own path to wealth.   If this sounds like something you’re interested in, just drop me a DM on LinkedIn or email me on lee@verdaniinvestments.co.uk – you can also visit my website at www.verdaniinvestments.co.uk for further info.

Summary: Following a career leading large and complex financial services businesses in Australia, Asia, the UK and US, now I mainly  point people in the right direction and give support along the way.   I work with startups and established businesses on their sales strategy and implementation, to help them expand their businesses, locally and across borders, and to push forward in terms of expansion of products, territories, or innovations. I do this as an advisor and mentor, or non-executive director. For example, I am on the advisory board of the Fine Art Bourse.  I advise on technical and financial business decisions and processes and I also make relevant and useful introductions and build connections across global jurisdictions on behalf of my clients. One of the things I have noticed with entrepreneurs is that it’s really lonely, especially at the startup phase (but not exclusively!). Entrepreneurs must be very versatile and agile – with a great idea, a healthy amount of optimism, a belief in their product, an open mind, and a willingness to grow. They want more than advice. They want to have a conversation or “pick a brain” with someone who won’t judge, who has experience and where there are no risks or hidden agendas. I am constantly surprised which parts people find valuable out of each conversation. Over the past few years I have performed a number of interim independent, non-executive roles at operational and board levels. I do pro-bono mentoring for post-grad students at LSE and Regents University and am involved in the entrepreneurial schools in those universities.
